definition: to drape over one's shoulders/to open/to unroll/to split open/to spread out

first of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/(used for an unspecified person or thing)/first (in a list, as a party to a contract etc)/letter "A" or roman "I" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/armor plating/shell or carapace/(of the fingers or toes) nail/bladed leather or metal armor (old)/ranking system used in the Imperial examinations (old)/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)/ancient Chinese compass point: 75°

sentences.english: Body with armored spine, well-developed tail fan, there are green, purple, color Banlan.
sentences.chinese: 全身披甲带棘，尾扇发达，绿中有紫，色彩斑澜。

sentences.english: Heavily armed and armored weapon platform.
sentences.chinese: 全副武装的和披甲的武器平台。

sentences.english: God's people would go to war whenever he called on them.
sentences.chinese: 只要神一呼召，神的子民便会披甲上阵。

sentences.english: The three pairs of armored legs assist in this pumping motion, as do a pair of pectoral guidance fins.
sentences.chinese: 三对披甲的肢脚和一对导航胸鳍协助这一水泵式运动。

sentences.english: Metroplex is very stocky looking and looks armored to the hilt.
sentences.chinese: 大都市是非常矮胖的体形，看起来像披甲的刀把。

sentences.english: I will wear an iron mask, and only when armed and mailed shall I seek them.
sentences.chinese: 我要戴上铁铸的面具，披甲戴盔后寻访他们。

definition: to put on a suit of armor/to put on dress/to wear
